strings: <se_high>Jessica: Do you mind explaining to me what we're doing here?
<se_high>Jessica: Sometimes, I don't know what's going on in your head, <hero>.

<se_low>Yangus: One-two-three-five! ♪
Hey, fiddle-dee-dee, ♫
it's a bandit's life for me! ♪

<se_low>Yangus: Come on! Join in!
Nothin' like a good ol' sing-song!
Should make us climb at least three times faster!

<se_def>Angelo: Now look!
I've gone and got mud on my boots.
Why did we have to come here anyway?

<se_def>Angelo: Are you some kind of masochist!?
Why don't we just turn back?<page>Angelo: I don't see what's so great about this monster-infested place.
What's the point in trudging up any further?

<se_def>Angelo: I've just about had enough of this.
If it gets any worse, I'm going back to the wagon.
<se_high>Jessica: ...(Gulp!)

<se_high>Jessica: What am I doing? I'm swallowing!
You know how your ears get clogged when you're in a high spot? That helps clear them.

<se_high>Jessica: You didn't know?
You should give it a try!

<se_low>Yangus: Just stick behind me if any ugly-lookin' monsters show their faces.
They won't get past ol' Yangus!
<se_low>Yangus: Watch where you're treadin' an' all. We don't want to go gettin' ourselves injured before we've seen the moon.
<se_def>Angelo: You'll tire yourself out chatting all the time, you know. And it'll probably attract monsters.
<se_def>Angelo: So just put a sock in it and keep moving.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel like I've been dreaming ever since last night.

<se_high>Jessica: I'm happy for King Pavan, anyway.
He seems to be cheering up again.
<se_high>Jessica: And he had a chance to see his beloved Queen one last time...
<se_high>Jessica: You know, I'd really like to see Alistair again, too.

<se_high>Jessica: But not right now. Not yet.
I'd probably just break down and cry and mess everything up.

<se_high>Jessica: Once I take care of Dhoulmagus, I'll be able to meet Alistair with a smile on my face.
He won't have to worry about me, then.
<se_high>Jessica: So I'm fine with not getting a chance to see him now. Even if Ishmahri offered, I'd probably say no.
<se_low>Yangus: Ever since I gave up me wicked ways, I ain't been so good at stayin' up of a night.
<se_low>Yangus: Anyway. Looks like the King's a bit 'appier now, so there ain't no need for us to 'ang around, is there?
<se_low>Yangus: I know it's temptin' to get a bit more o' that grub down yer gullet, but you've gotta know when to stop. Like me!

<se_def>Angelo: Those eyes. Those lips.
That voice. That immaculate poise.
...I can't put her out of my mind.
<se_def>Angelo: She's well worth lamenting for twenty years, let alone two. And far too good for that drip Pavan.
<se_def>Angelo: If only I'd come here a couple of years earlier, I'd have been able to ‘make her acquaintance’ in the flesh. What a waste!
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.

<se_def>Angelo: The troll king said we should go to the library and find out about the ship.
Don't want to disobey orders now!
<se_high>Jessica: I really hate to say this, but I think coming all the way out here was a big mistake.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go back into town. We can get more information that way. Don't you think?

<se_low>Yangus: Where's that 'arp, eh? I dunno.
Can't see anyfin' like that round 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Still, I s'pose we'll come across it sooner or later if we keep ploddin' along.

<se_def>Angelo: Are you trying to break the world record for walking the furthest or something?
I think a bit of focus may be required here. Right?
<se_high>Jessica: Sounds like the thief who stole the Moonshadow harp is somewhere beyond that tunnel we saw in Ascantha Castle.
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't walk away empty-handed.
Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.
<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us. Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: This is so exciting! Come on, let's hurry! Back to Trodain Castle and into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.

<se_high>Jessica: Hey. We have a ship now, remember?
It's not like we can't ever come back here again.
<se_high>Jessica: In fact, we can come back whenever we like. So why don't we hop on the ship and head west now?
<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus come from Farebury to Maella, and then on to the west over the sea.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv! Let's get the ship 'eaded west!
<se_def>Angelo: I heard that the world's biggest casino is over on the western continent.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we could just drop in there on our way? Add a bit of interest to this trailing around after Dhoulmagus.<page>Angelo: After all, all work and no play makes Angelo a dull boy.
<se_high>Jessica: I hope you aren't thinking of climbing this mountain to get closer to Rhapthorne.

<se_high>Jessica: Empyrea lent us the ability to fly, remember?
I hope you haven't forgotten that already!

<se_low>Yangus: Climbin' mountains is great for buildin' up the ol' muscles!
Nice one, guv!

<se_low>Yangus: One-two-three-five! ♪
Hey, fiddle-dee-dee... ♫

<se_def>Angelo: Have you ever heard that saying about how only fools and monkeys climb up to high places?<page>Angelo: It just sprang to mind for some reason.
...Got a banana!?
<se_high>Red: Wot's yer plan, eh? You wanna get a better view of wot we're up against or summat?
<se_high>Red: This ain't the time for messin' about like this, ya know. Nah, we should be callin' on the old Godbird and gettin' straight in there for a scrap, I say!
<se_low>Morrie: We power up to the top of the mountain, ay? I like your thinking! Si, there is still time to build our bodies before we make prosciutto from the Rhapthorne!
<se_low>Morrie: Or we just go and mince his meat now, ay? Me, I can go either ways.
